derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: from Anglo-Norman French (infinitive used as a noun), from Old French demourer 'remain, stay' (see demur)

means.word_mean: 1. (law) a formal objection to an opponent's pleadings
2. (law) any pleading that attacks the legal sufficiency of the opponent's pleadings
3. a defendant's answer or plea denying the truth of the charges against him;
